# Väestö csv with kunta ids
df_ids = spark.read.csv("abfss://vaesto@group2projectstorage.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/vaesto23.csv", header=True, inferSchema=True)

# Municipality data without kunta ids
df_combined = spark.read.parquet("abfss://vaesto@group2projectstorage.dfs.core.windows.net/silver/combined/combined_data.parquet/")

display(df_ids)

# Assuming df_combined is your DataFrame
df_ids_id = df_ids.select("id").distinct().count()
df_ids_kunta = df_ids.select("kunta").distinct().count()

print(f"Distinct count of id: {df_ids_id}")

print(f"Distinct count of kunta: {df_ids_kunta}")

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# Join based on 'kunta'
df_combined_ids = df_combined.join(df_ids, on=["kunta"], how="outer")

# Reorder columns so that 'id' comes first
df_combined_ids = df_combined_ids.select("id", *[col for col in df_combined_ids.columns if col != "id"])

#Filter out rows where 'id' is null or undefined
df_combined_ids = df_combined_ids.filter(F.col("id").isNotNull())

# Assuming df_combined is your DataFrame
distinct_kunta_count = df_combined_ids.select("kunta").distinct().count()

print(f"Distinct count of kunta: {distinct_kunta_count}")

# Delete column "kunta"
df_combined_ids = df_combined_ids.drop("kunta")

# Order by 'kunta' first, then 'id'
df_combined_ids = df_combined_ids.orderBy(F.col("id"), F.col("vuosi"))


display(df_combined_ids)
